abstract: Whew! General Electric met analyst’s forecasts Friday morning when it announced second-quarter earnings, after last quarter’s quasi-disaster, when G.E. missed badly. I guess that means Jeff Immelt get to keep his job as C.E.O. I’m being only mildly facetious.
lead_paragraph: Whew! General Electric met analyst’s forecasts Friday morning when it announced second-quarter earnings, after last quarter’s quasi-disaster, when G.E. missed badly. I guess that means Jeff Immelt get to keep his job as C.E.O. I’m being only mildly facetious.
